content: cratchit cable braid gloves a free pattern from dancing triceratops designs copyright 2018 patricia mcmahon a pattern note the gloves pictured were made with patons kroy socks fx yarn in the clover colors colorway i originally made the gloves specifically to fit my hand so i am making an educated guess on the necessary length to scale the gloves up and down for different sizes to achieve the best fit for your own hand you will want to try on the gloves as you knit to be sure length from wrist to base of thumb and fingers as well as length of fingers is correct i knit the thumb and fingers to end at the first knuckle below the fingertip if you wish to make these as full gloves instead of the bob cratchit style with missing fingertips knit fingers to just past length of appropriate finger knit a round of k2tog then cut yarn and pull tail through stitches to close finger cratchit cable braid gloves page 1 of 6 www dancingtriceratops com sizing and gauge sizes circumference around palm 5 /12 5 cm 6 /15 cm 7 /17 5 cm 8 /20 cm 9 /22 5 cm 10 /25 cm gauge 30 stitches and 40 row over 4 inches/10 cm in stockinette stitch materials patons kroy socks fx yarn fingering weight 50g/166 yd/152 m 1 1 2 2 2 2 skeins small pieces of waste yarn or yarn holders five double-pointed needles or two 24 61cm circular needles in size u s 2 2 75 mm or size to obtain gauge cable needle stitch markers tapestry needle abbreviations k knit m1l make one left see techniques below m1r make one right see techniques below p purl pm place marker rem remaining round s round back into the running yarn between next stitch and stitch just knitted into knit through the back loop of the stitch to create an extra stitch cratchit cable braid gloves page 2 of 6 www dancingtriceratops com m1r insert your right needle from front to back into the running yarn between next stitch and stitch just knitted into put loop on left needle and knit into it to create an
